p: The rationale for using pure EPA instead of the more habitual fish oil mix of EPA and DHA is that the latter purportedly increases LDL-cholesterol concentrations more than the former [ 94, 95, 96], at least in hypertriglyceridemic patients [ 97]. This effect is more pronounced in ApoE4 carriers and may, in part, negate the cardioprotective action of DHA in this population subgroup [ 98].
